title: French PM fights back against attacks on economy - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: european markets edge higher but rally runs out of steam .
rio tinto us shares jump on glencore merger report .
french pm blasts those who claim france is finished .
recession fears as eurozone investor confidence slides .
struggling euro disney gets cash injection .
uk september car sales are strongest since 2004

documents.title: european markets edge higher but rally runs out of steam
text: the rally which began on friday after better than expected us non-farm payroll figures continued today in early trading , before running out of steam .
investors shrugged off more disappointing eurozone data , with confidence at its worst level for a year , and pushed shares higher .
but an early reversal on wall street took some of the shine off , and european markets closed off their best levels .

the closing scores showed : the ftse 100 finished up 35.74 points or 0.55 % at 6563.65 germany 's dax added 0.15 % to 9209.51 france 's cac climbed 0.11 % to 4286.52 spain 's ibex ended 0.74 & higher at 10,645.7 italy 's ftse mib was an exception , down 0.4 % at 20,119.73 in the us , the dow jones industrial average - up more than 200 points on friday - is currently 57 points or 0.33 % lower .
on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back tomorrow .
neil hume ( @ humenm ) glencore plc glen.l spokesman says `` we do n't comment on market rumour or speculation , '' in response to on glencore/rio tinto merger report

documents.title: rio tinto us shares jump on glencore merger report
text: rio tinto 's us shares have jumped following a bloomberg report that glencore was laying the groundwork for a potential $ 160bn merger .

the report said : as a preliminary step , glencore has reached out to aluminium corp of china , the chinese state-backed company that is rio tinto 's largest shareholder , to gauge its interest in a potential deal , said two of the people , who asked not to be identified because the matter is private .
the discussions with the company , which is known as chinalco and controls about 9.8 % of rio , took place in recent weeks , one of them said .
rio executives are well aware of glencore chief executive officer ivan glasenberg 's interest in a deal , which has been made clear in informal settings , the people said .
however , no talks are underway between the two companies , no formal offer has been made , none is likely before the end of 2014 , and glencore could decide against an offer , they said .

that disclaimer has not stopped rio 's adrs in the us : neil hume ( @ humenm ) rio tinto 's adrs rio.n up 9.5 pct on bloomberg report of possible 2015 merger with glencore glen.l the full bloomberg story is here .

over in greece , prime minister antonis samaras has today requested a vote of confidence in his government in a bid to quash growing speculation of early elections and the political instability it has spawned .

from athens our correspondent helena smith reports : presenting the request at the office of the president of the parliament , the greek prime minister said he had sought to seek a vote of confidence in his government as outlined in article 84 of the constitution . ''

the gamble - a high risk affair in light of the growing distaste of governing mps for the reforms the ruling coalition is under pressure to take by international creditors - was decided as the only riposte left to calls for early elections by the main opposition syriza party .
both samaras and his junior partner socialist leader evangelos venizelos see the vote as the best way of not only silencing dissidents but bolstering support for their shaky coalition .

popular approval may not be behind the government - polls have steadfastly put syriza in the lead - but the hope is that when push comes to shove parliamentarians will back the coalition in the name of political stability .
greek prime minister antonis samaras .

photo : odd andersen/afp/getty images although clinging to power with a wafer thin majority of four , samaras ' two-party administration also hopes to up votes from independents sitting in the 300-seat house .
the ballot , eleven months after syriza engineered a similar vote , would buy the two leaders valuable time to forge ahead with reforms under the guise of having a popular mandate .

in addition to the 2015 budget the samaras administration has to press ahead with scores of unpopular structural reforms by the end of the year at the behest of greece 's troika '' of creditors at the eu , ecb and imf .
piling on the pressure syriza 's leader , the telegenic alexis tsipras , has said the measures will only lead the country further down the road to destruction . ''
confidence votes are normally seen as a last resort for a government .

but if ( as seems likely ) samaras is victorious political commentators unanimously agree it will force tsipras into the shadows - at least until presidential elections in february when parliament will need to replace the incumbent head of state carolos papaoulias .
earlier , presenting the 2015 budget , deputy finance minister christos staikouras boldly declared that the worst of the economic crisis was over .
a sculpture at the athens stock exchange as greece announced plans to issue a seven-year and 10-year bond as part of its 2015 budget .
photo reuters/alkis konstantinidis konstantinidis/reuters
after a 200 point rise on wall street on friday as us jobs figures beat expectations , markets are heading higher once more .
the dow jones industrial average has added another 70 points or 0.42 % in initial trading , helping to prolong the earlier rises in europe .
so the ftse 100 has risen 57 points or 0.89 % while germany 's dax - closed on friday and playing a bit of catch up - is up 1 % while france 's cac has climbed 0.77 % .
virgin atlantic 's uk domestic airline little red has stalled after just over 18 months in service .

my colleague gwyn topham writes : the airline has struggled to fill seats on its services linking london heathrow with edinburgh , aberdeen and manchester , and finally admitted defeat after weeks of speculation that the operation would be axed .
virgin 's daily services to manchester will end in march 2015 , while the scottish services will cease next september .

sir richard branson , virgin atlantic 's president , claimed that little red , which was operated by aer lingus for virgin on a wet lease '' , ie with the irish airline 's planes and crew in virgin colours , had benefited consumers but the odds were stacked against us '' .
virgin atlantic 's little red .

photo : jeff j mitchell/getty images j mitchell/getty images it came into being in march 2013 after competition authorities made british airways relinquish heathrow slots for domestic flying , in the wake of ba 's takeover of bmi .

while over a million customers have so far flown on little red , virgin admitted that demand has been predominantly from point-to-point customers rather than the connecting traffic it had hoped for , feeding more passengers on to its more profitable long haul routes .
full story here : virgin atlantic scraps little red domestic services

here is my colleague patrick wintour 's report on manuel valls ' speech : the french prime minister , manuel valls , has told a city audience in london that his drastic reform programme will extend to the introduction of sunday shopping in paris , and the major towns of france .
valls is fighting on all fronts to lift the french economy out of the doldrums , and may face a confrontation with the new european commission to tolerate a deficit that breaches eu limits .
valls was in london to meet david cameron and persuade fellow eu leaders that he is trying to take the french economy on the path to structural reform , including an end to the 35-hour working week .
describing it as bad news to give you here in london '' , valls said shops would open on sundays in paris and promised museums will be open seven days week .
he said socialists were pro-business and he would use his time in power to transform the country .
he said he had accepted the apology from the john lewis managing director who described france as sclerotic , hopeless and downbeat .
valls pointed out that the french economy was the fifth largest in the world and second largest in europe .
insisting his new government was pro-business , he said the top 75 % tax rate would be gone by january .
cameron was told by valls that he wanted britain to remain a central figure in the eu , saying the eu without the uk would be amputated .
but he also warned the city of london would lose much if it turned its back on europe .
patrick 's full story is here .

documents.title: valls : a socialist french prime minister in the city is a revolution !
text: french prime minister manuel valls delivers a speech at the guildhall in london , on october 6 , 2014 .

stansall/afp/getty images the afp newswire have written up valls ' speech , including a good line about how a socialist pm visiting the city is a major event ( which i missed in the earlier summary ) french pm bids to restore pro-business stance in london french prime minister manuel valls on monday defended his socialist government against a stream of criticism of its economic and business reforms during a visit to london .
valls met british counterpart david cameron and british and french executives , giving a speech at the guildhall in the heart of the british capital 's city financial district .
french president francois hollande was elected in part on a tough line towards the financial sector .
valls has provoked anger on the left of the socialist partly by defending stalled reforms to cut charges on companies and to cut public spending , and praising the importance of businesses .
my government is pro-business ! ''
he told british business leaders in english , quipping : a french prime minister in the city is an event .
a socialist french prime minister in the city is a revolution ! `` .

stansall/afp/getty images in response to rising euroscepticism in britain , valls also warned that the country - and in particular the city - would lose a lot '' if it were to turn its back '' on europe .
france wants britain to stay in the european union , '' he said , calling also for joint action to reform europe and make it more intelligible to bring it closer to the people '' .
he added : there is a choice that we can and should make together : reform europe to put growth , competitiveness and jobs back at the heart of its priorities . ''

relations have improved between london and paris since 2012 , when cameron said britain would roll out the red carpet '' for french executives following the election of president francois hollande , who had declared the finance sector his enemy '' .
the french prime minister , who arrived in london late on sunday , began his trip by meeting the french business community in london , home to more than 350,000 french people .
he admitted that france 's economic growth had been stuck in a long breakdown '' but said people should not resign themselves '' and encouraged british businesses to invest in france .
finland 's man in london , ambassador pekka huhtaniemi , also flags up manuel valls ' warning that the european union would be 'amputated ' without britain .
pekka huhtaniemi ( @ huhtapekka ) pm valls @ guildhall : french governm .
is pro-business & capable to execute necessary reforms .
`` brexit '' a major worry .
valls said it would be a disaster '' for britain and the eu if the uk were to leave .

documents.title: reaction to the french pm 's city speech
text: vincenzo scarpetta of the open europe think tank reckons manuel valls mounted a solid defence of france 's plans in his guildhall speech .

but he also warns that valls downplayed the political situation in paris ( where the national front party won its first seats in the senate last month ) vincenzo scarpetta ( @ londonervince ) back from guildhall speech of french pm # valls .
sounded convincing on reform , but # france 's political situation trickier than he described .

from brussels , martin wittenberg of euros / agency reckons david cameron should now respond by promoting his own pro-eu credentials martin wittenberg ( @ martwittenberg ) `` my government is pro business '' dixit french pm valls in the city .

now waiting for cameron 's speech in paris `` my government is pro european '' the city of london corporation 's linda cross welcomed valls ' pro-enterprise message : linda cross ( @ licross ) glad to hear french pm confirm his govt is pro-business ; welcomes scotland remaining in uk ; wants uk in eu ; & gare du nord needs updating !
fiona tait , director of international markets at deloitte , was struck by valls ' warning that britain should not turn its back on europe .
fiona tait ( @ fionaxtait ) it will be like europe being amputated if uk leaves eu .
we are all stronger together .
french pm @ twitterid

documents.title: lunchtime summary : french pm bangs the drum in london
text: prime minister david cameron and french prime minister manuel valls at downing street .
cyril/sipa/rex france 's prime minister has insisted that his government is 'pro-business ' , on a trip to the uk to promote paris 's economic reforms and fend off criticism of its weak growth .
speaking to an audience of top british executives in the guildhall , manuel valls insisted that france could , and would , reform its economy .
he declared : my government is pro-business .
and also hit out at business people who unfairly criticise the french economy .
france , valls pointed out , is still the world 's fifth-largest economy ( although the uk is expected to overtake this year ) .
french prime minister manuel valls ( l ) delivers a speech at the guildhall in london , on october 6 , 2014 .

stansall/afp/getty images the visit was overshadowed , or perhaps enlivened , by the row last friday after john lewis 's managing director said france was finished ' and dubbed gare du nord the squalor pit of europe '' .
valls said france 's is the regular target of 'biased ' attacks from the uk press .
but he has accepted andy street 's apology , and even agreed that the station needs upgrading .

joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) french pm valls : i see every day bias and attacks in your newspapers towards my country geraldine amiel ( @ geraldineamiel ) gare du nord must be renovated , says # france pm # valls to # london audience , in a smirk , as reference to john lewis ceo comments # eurostar he argued that france and the uk face similar challenges , and told guildhall that the 75 % top rate of tax introduced by francois hollande will be reversed next year .
that policy was credited with driving some high earners across the channel .
valls also warned london that french shops and museums will soon be fighting back , by opening on sundays .
he told the city that i have two years and half ahead of me '' to reform france 's economy .
and he also hit out against euroscepticism , saying the city would suffer if britain left the eu .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) french 75pc tax on rich will be reversed - from 1 jan i think he said .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) `` we can reform in france and do it quickly. ``
angelina rascouët ( @ arascouet ) french pm manuel valls tells the city of london my government is pro business and we 'll work on that gare du nord .

valls is visiting london on a day of generally bad economic news from europe concern is growing that the eurozone is sliding into recession , after investor confidence in the region hit its lowest level in almost 18 months .
sentix 's senior analyst , dr. sebastian wanke , who compiled the report , warned that investors are increasingly gloomy about current conditions , and future prospects .
: a formal euro-area recession - two consecutive quarters of shrinking output - becomes more and more probable .
on the slide german factories have suffered the biggest drop in orders since 2009 , as demand from home and abroad weakens .
analysts say russian sanctions and the weak euro economy are hitting the region 's largest member .
carsten brzeski of ing explained : it 's not only a putin fear factor - germany is also suffering from the weakness of its euro zone peers . ''
german factory orders over the last decade economy ministry/fastft euro disney , the paris-based theme park , has announced a $ 1bn refinancing plan in a bid to cut debts and attract more visitors .
shares tumbled 20 % in early trading , and are now down 8 % in paris .
greece has presented its draft 2015 budget , and pledged to return to growth this year .
uk car registrations have hit their highest level for a september in a decade .
however , growth may be tailing off .
and that 's the end of valls ' guildhall speech .
he 'll be off to meet ed miliband later - i 'll pull together a lunchtime summary now
open europe ( @ openeurope ) french pm # valls speaking in guildhall .
only sentence in english of his speech was : `` my government is pro-business '' .
valls also warns that europe faces rising support for euroscepticism and populist parties .
city of london ( @ cityoflondon ) policy chairman @ twitterid chairs q & a session with # french pm # manuelvalls here at guildhall , city of # london
back in guildhall , uk business leaders are quizzing the french prime minister .

valls ducks a question from the chief executive of prudential , tidjane thiam , who asks about france 's deficit reduction targets : joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) thijane thiam ceo of prudential asks roughly where the french budget deficit will end up ?
valls : 'i 'm too clever to answer that '
britain 's prime minister david cameron ( l ) greets french prime minister manuel valls ( 2nd r ) outside 10 downing street in london , on october 6 , 2014 .
dennis/afp/getty images before speaking at guildhall today , manuel valls met with david cameron at 10 downing street to discus how to respond to the islamic state .

they also spoke about economic issues ; speaking before the meeting , uk pm conceded that the two countries do face similar problems : here 's the press association 's take : david cameron and french prime minister manuel valls have met to discuss measures to prevent would-be jihadis travelling to iraq and syria to join forces with islamic state ( is ) militants .
the prime minister welcomed mr valls to downing street for talks about the international effort to combat is - also known as isil - and he said the uk and france were strong allies '' .
the pair were also expected to talk about the economic challenges facing the two countries during the meeting at no 10 .

both france and the uk have launched air strikes against is fighters in iraq , and both nations have seen hundreds of their citizens travel to the middle east to potentially link up with militant groups .
mr cameron said : there 's a lot to discuss today .
as strong allies within the european union and nato , we both face the same challenge in responding to isil in iraq and syria .
i 'm sure we will discuss that and how we prevent fighters from leaving our shores to go to these countries . ''
on the economy , mr cameron acknowledged that he was from different political families '' to the french socialist , but he said the two countries faced the same challenges .

mr cameron said : i 'm sure we will have a lot to talk about on the economy , where the bilateral relationship is very strong , we both have the same challenges of getting our economies to grow and generate jobs and wealth .
while we are from different political families , i 'm sure there is a lot that we can share in terms of experience about what needs to happen . ''
itele ( @ itele ) # valls ( en anglais dans le texte ) `` : `` my government is pro-business ''

valls also argues that europe needs a weaker currency , to help exporters compete : joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) valls : it 's important that the euro goes down in value esp in the battle between airbus and boeing the euro has fallen by 10 % in the last six months , from $ 1.38 to $ 1.25 .
but valls wants it to keep depreciating
valls is n't shying away from the problems in europe 's economy ; he 's arguing that the eurozone must rethink its monetary policies ( a hint that the ecb should launch more stimulus measures ) .
the eurozone can not be the only region without growth , he adds .
that 's a timely warning .
as covered earlier ( details ) , investor confidence in the eurozone has tumbled this month , suggesting another recession is looming .
especially with german factory orders tumbling in august ( details )
the french pm also touches on britain 's position in the european union ( earlier today he met with david cameron at downing street ) .
valls declares that europeans must remain united and strong '' , and warns that the city would suffer if britain quit the eu .
joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) valls : france wishes uk to remain with eu .
city of london would lose a lot if it turned its back on eu
more seriously , manuel valls says that i have two years and half ahead of me '' in which he can reform french economy .
he 's confident that he can achieve that goal , he adds .
john lewis 's managing director may have hit home with his attack on the gare de nurd as 'the squalor pit of europe ' .

prime minister valls gets his guildhall audience giggling by declaring that the station does need upgrading : geraldine amiel ( @ geraldineamiel ) gare du nord must be renovated , says # france pm # valls to # london audience , in a smirk , as reference to john lewis ceo comments # eurostar
as an example of the new economic powerhouse brewing over the channel , french pm valls tells his audience that shops and museums will soon be open seven days a week !
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) shops in paris will open on sundays .
museums 7 days a week .
joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) valls : bad news for london , paris shops will soon open on sundays and our museums will also be open every day
valls insists that france can , and will , reform its economy : sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) `` we can reform in france and do it quickly. ``

documents.title: french pm : we are pro-business
text: manuel valls insists that his government is pro-business '' , speaking in english to get his point across to the guildhall audience .
and he hopes that france can transform itself into an economic powerhouse '' .
joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) valls : the 75 % top income tax in france will be reversed on jan 1st
valls says the attack on france by john lewis 's md was out of line , given it is the 5th largest economy in the world .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) french pm says andy street forgot france is no 5 economy in world and 2nd in europe .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) french pm also points out french army fighting terrorism in iraq .

documents.title: french pm blasts those who claim france is finished
text: prime minister manuel valls is now blasting the everyday bias '' seen in the uk press against france , saying there are regular attacks in british newspapers towards his country .
he takes a pop at john lewis 's managing director , who apologised last friday for saying france was sclerotic , hopeless and downbeat '' .

my colleague sean farrell is tweeting from the guildhall : sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) french pm refers to `` british businessman who all of a sudden had some kind of vision who said france was over '' .

geraldine amiel ( @ geraldineamiel ) pm # valls : # uk , # france facing similar challenges mocks john lewis ceo who said france was finished and says accepts his apologies city of london ( @ cityoflondon ) prime minister of # france manueline valls speaking on economic growth at guildhall this morning

documents.title: french pm starts speaking in london
text: heads-up .
france 's prime minister , manuel valls , has begun speaking at the guildhall in the city of london .

he 's started by defending his visit to the cradle of anglo-saxon capitalism : michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) valls says it 's false a socialist pm should n't meet bankers itele ( @ itele ) manuel # valls : `` un premier ministre français socialiste a la city , c'est une revolution ''

documents.title: greece outlines 2015 budget
text: greece 's deputy finance minister christos staikouras .
gouliamaki/afp/getty images over in greece , the government has declared that it will exit its recession this year , as it outlines its 2015 budget .

deputy finance minister christos staikouras boldly declared that the worst of greece 's economic crisis is over : the country is entering a long period of sustained economic growth rates and primary surpluses that will bring growth in employment , reducing unemployment and improving living standards for all citizens . ''
this is the result of unprecedented sacrifices made by greek society , households and businesses .
these sacrifices must not be wasted . ''
saikouras also told reporters that the draft document will be debated in an environment of stabilisation of the country 's public finances and the return of its international credibility . ''

here are the highlights from the budget , from athens correspondent helena smith : after six years of recession - the longest in recorded history - greece 's national output was poised to grow by 0.6 % this year , after falling by 3.9 % in 2013 , he said .

after triggering the euro zone crisis and being forced to enact excoriating austerity , the debt-stricken country was on track to post a primary surplus ( before repayment of interest payments ) of €3.6bn euro , the equivalent of 2 % of gdp .
at 0.8 % , the public deficit had also improved from the 1.9 % and 5.8 % that it showed in 2013 and 2012 respectively .
unemployment , at 27 % , was the the highest in the eu - some 1.4 million greeks are out of work .
the nation 's public debt load expected to come in at €318.6bn euro or 175 % of gdp .

but it 's not all good news , helena adds : protestors from the public and private sector are expected to take to the streets later in the day in a mass display of the opposition to the cost-cutting policies that have seen greece 's gdp shrink by over 25 % since the outbreak of the crisis .
now this is serious , the price of coffee has surged by almost 9 % today , a two and a half-year high .
the benchmark price of aribica coffee for delivery next march jumped to $ 2.29 a pound .

it was triggered by concerns over brazil 's weather , where the usual october rain has n't arrived ( yet ) chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) ice march coffee price has surged almost 9 per cent to $ 2.29 a pound , on fears about the weather in brazil , the world 's largest producer
as if we 'd not had enough bad news already , the ft 's ralph atkins flags up another sell signal : paul davies ( @ pauljdavies ) top drawer .
rt @ twitterid : teatime reading : the next financial apocalypse is imminent because

back in the city , shares in uk web retailer asos are up almost 6 % on speculation that amazon might be planning a bid guardian business ( @ businessdesk ) asos jumps 5 % as analysts suggest growing chance of bid from amazon

documents.title: recession fears as eurozone investor confidence slides
text: further bad news for europe this morning investors in europe are at their most pessimistic in over a year , suggesting that the region is falling into recession .
that 's according to research group sentix , whose index of investor morale tumbled to minus 13.7 this month , the lowest since may 2013 .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) ez sentix - worst number since may 2013 and the index has nose-dived from +10 at the start of the year .

-13.7 vs -11 exp & -9.8 last sentix 's senior analyst , dr. sebastian wanke , warns : as the assessment of the current situation and the 6-month expectations both are now clearly in negative territory , the sentix indices point currently to a recession in the euro area .

eurozone confidence , to october 2014 markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) more bad news for the eurozone : sentix index falls from -9.8 in september to -13.7 in october the slide in sentiment ( for the third month running ) comes despite the european central bank 's latest stimulus scheme .
it announced last week that it would start buying packages of debt from eurozone banks to encourage lending and growth in the region .
the poll took place between thursday ( the ecb 's last meeting ) and saturday .
sentix suggests that investors may have lost faith in the ecb : obviously , the ecb 's monetary sword has lost its power in this regard - at least for the moment .
the survey also found that german investors are less confident , with future expectations already in negative territory .
and sentix 's measure of the global economy also fell , to its lowest point since november 2012 , as investors become more gloomy about future prospects .
wanke warns : according to the sentix indices the world economy thus is about to enter a downturn .
here 's the full report ( pdf ) .
eurozone economic sentiment , to october 2014

documents.title: struggling euro disney gets cash injection
text: mickey mouse and minnie mouse in front of the sleeping beauty castle at euro disney .
mori/ap shares in euro disney are sliding like bambi on ice , after the ailing theme park chain announced a €1bn funding deal backed by its us parent company this morning .
the deal will see euro disney raise €420m from its shareholders in a rights issue .
walt disney will also convert €600m of borrowings into shares , and delay scheduled repayments on its loans to euro disney until 2024 .
euro disney president tomn wolber blamed the ongoing economic challenges in europe '' for pushing down visitor numbers at pasis-based attraction , and driving up its debt pile to €1.75bn .
euro disney hopes the debt restructuring and cash injection will allow it to invest in its business and attract more customer .
shares in euro disney are down 20 % this morning .
full story : euro disney gets cash injection from us owner

documents.title: uk september car sales are strongest since 2004
text: britain 's car industry has posted its strongest sales figure for a september in a decade .
the society of motor manufacturers and traders reported that 425,861 new vehicles were registered last month , a 5.6 % jump , and the best september since 2004 .
uk car sales have now been rising for 31 months in a row .

smmt ceo mike hawes says that the new '64 ' numberplate had helped to push sales up : demand for the new 64-plate has been boosted by intensifying confidence in the uk economy , with consumers attracted by a wide range of exciting , increasingly fuel-efficient , new cars .
in the months since march - which saw an 18 % jump in registrations - the growth has shown signs of levelling off as the market starts to find its natural running rate . ''

sky news business ( @ skynewsbiz ) 425,861 new uk cars registered in the key month of september , a rise of 5.6 % and the biggest september figure since 2004 total sales during 2014 are 9.1 % higher than a year ago , so - as this chart shows - september 's figures may suggest growth is slowing.. and this chart shows that the ford fiesta remains the most popular car : .
the russian ruble has fallen to fresh record lows today , hitting the 40 rubles to the us dollar mark .
fears over western sanctions , the strength of the russian economy , and recent falls in the oil price have all driven the ruble lower in recent days .
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) ruble getting rumbled .
( again )

documents.title: french pm visits london , here 's his timetable
text: here 's the agenda of french prime minister valls ' visit to london today , from the french embassy .

8.30am meets the french business community 10.00am meets prime minister david cameron at 10 downing street 11.00am arrives at the guildhall and delivers a speech 3.45pm meets ed miliband , leader of the opposition
just in , germany 's building sector stabilised in september , having contracted in august .
the monthly german construction pmi rose to 50.0 , showing stagnation , up from 47.7 in august .
finsec advisory serv ( @ finsec com ) german construction activity stabilises in september , ending 5-month sequence of contraction .
headline # pmi at 50.0 robin wigglesworth ( @ robinwigg ) at least the german construction pmi bounced back to 50 in sept .

documents.title: a solid start to trading in europe
text: european stock markets have risen in early trading , despite the weak german factory orders .
traders are catching up with friday night 's rally on wall street , after a strong us jobs report showed the unemployment rate had fallen to just 5.9 % .
germany 's dax is leading the risers , up 1.2 % , having been closed on friday for a holiday .
european stock markets , morning , october 5th 2014 reuters tesco is leading the risers in london , having fallen steadily since it admitted overstating profits by £ 250m a forntight ago .
adam parsons ( @ adamparsons1 ) tesco shares up 1.5 % .
soaring like a private jet speaking of which tesco board faces new questions after purchase of $ 50m corporate jet

there was one flicker of good news in the german data ; july 's orders were revised higher : markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) german factory orders drop 5.7 % m/m in august ( biggest fall since 2009 ) , versus reuters consensus of a 2.5 % drop .
july revised up to +4.9
nick bubb , retail analyst .

says tesco 's boardroom reinforcements should cheer the city , as speculation of a cash call swirls : embattled tesco shareholders will be pleased to see today 's news that two heavyweight non-execs are to join the tesco board , but less pleased if they are being softened up for a rights issue

documents.title: tesco beefs up its board
text: meanwhile in the uk , troubled supermarket chain tesco has boosted its board with two new non-executive directors .
the chief executive of food group compass , and the former boss of ikea , both join next month , as tesco struggles to stem its falling sales and the revelation that it overstated profits by £ 250m .
more here .

documents.title: ing : do n't just blame putin
text: carsten brzeski , senior economist at ing , has warned that today 's german factory orders figures clearly bodes ill for the fourth quarter , '' .
he says that the crisis over ukraine is one factor , but not the only one : it 's not only a putin fear factor - germany is also suffering from the weakness of its euro zone peers . ''
looking back at the data orders from eurozone countries fell by 5.7 % , while orders from the rest of the world are down 9.9 % ( compared to the 2.0 % drop in domestic orders ) .

documents.title: credit agricole : europe 's supply chain is weakening
text: credit agricole 's frederik ducrozet points out german factories also saw weak demand for 'intermediate goods ' ( materials or product used to create other items ) : frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) starting the week with some weak european industrial data for a change .
german aug .
factory orders drop 5.7 % ; median est .
2.5 % decline frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) main source of weakness in german factory data : foreign orders for intermediate goods .
europe supply chain .
this handy graph from fastft shows how german factory orders plummeted in august , at a rate not seen since the start of 2009 : german factory orders .
to august 2014 economy ministry/fastft
the 5.7 % tumble in german factory suggests growth in the last quarter could be disappointing .

holger sandte , chief european analyst at nordea markets in copenhagen , cites various geopolitical concerns threatening germany : the outlook for the german economy is subdued and i 'm not sure we 'll see growth in the third quarter .
looking forward , there are some signs for worry , from china to weakness in france , to the crisis in russia . ''
sky news business ( @ skynewsbiz ) german industrial orders , a key measure of demand both domestically and abroad , fell sharply in aug ( down 5.7 % ) on july 's figure

documents.title: the agenda ; german factory orders tumble
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and finance .
worrying news from europe - german factories have suffered the biggest drop in new orders since the financial crisis was raging five years ago .
the german economy ministry just reported that orders tumbled by 5.7 % in august , more than twice as sharp a fall as expected .
it 's the biggest fall since the start of 2009 ; adding to concerns that europe 's largest economy is faltering .
overseas orders plunged by 8.4 % compared to july , indicating that german firms are being hit by the weakness of the eurozone economy , and beyond .
the domestic economy does n't look too hot either , with orders from within germany down by 2.0 % .
demand for capital goods ( heavy-duty machinery ) was particularly weak , dropping by 8.5 % month-on-month ; foreign orders slid by 12 % .
the economy ministry blamed subdued economic developments ' in the euro areas , and the uncertainly created by crises abroad , adding to the august summer slowdown .
this comes just two weeks after german business confidence fell for the fifth month running .

reaction to follow also coming up today : france 's prime minister manuel valls arrives in london today to explain his economic strategy , just days after the head of john lewis apologised for claiming that that french economy was 'finished ' the pm 's message is that france is serious about reforms , as bloomberg reports : valls , whose trip to london had been scheduled before street 's comments , begins his day meeting expatriates in the british capital , followed by one with prime minister david cameron at 10am .
he will then give a speech in the city , london 's financial district , and then meet labour party leader ed miliband before heading back to paris .
more here : valls goes to london to counter charge that france is 'finished ' we find out how many new cars were sold in the uk at 9am bst , when the registration figures for september are released .
sentix releases its estimate for investor confidence in the eurozone , at i 'll be tracking all the main events through the day
